College requirements and the secondary curriculum; addresses presented at the Educational conference held at the University of Vermont in connection with the inauguration of Guy Potter Benton as president of the university, October fifth, nineteen hundred eleven

Introduction [by] J.F. Messenger. -- Present tendencies in college education [by] John Dewey. -- Present tendencies in secondary education [by E.C. Moore. -- Preparation for college [by] J.E. Lough. -- The small high school and thecollege [by] E.M. Roscoe. -- The doomed pupil [by] J.P. Taylor. -- The inspirational effect of college possibilities [by] E.L. Ingalls. -- The new requirements at the University of Chicago [by] J.H. Tufts. -- Discussion [by] J.A. Dale. -- Discussion [by] L.R. Allen. -- Education and the state [by] G.P. Benton.
